title: Bug 21706: BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706: BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage.
OB: The current implementation of BidiUtil in the win32 version has a line that uses Class.forName(). This line throws a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC class libraries, causing a problem in the CLDC version of SWT. This problem is only visible if jxeLink or a similar tool is used. The Eclipse compiler and Sun's compiler do not produce any compiler errors related to this issue.
EB: To address this problem, a private constructor should be added to BidiUtil. Since there are no nonstatic methods in this class, making the constructor private is a good practice. This change does not add any size because the compiler automatically generates a public constructor.
SR: Steps to reproduce: 1. Open the BidiUtil class in the win32 version. 2. Look for the line that initializes the static Callback object using Class.forName().
